_header: O Lord Our Lord Thy name how marvelous
Title(s): Prioress’s Prologue; Domine dominus noster; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Prioress’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 35 lines in 7-line, rhyme royal stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
O lord thi name now merveilouseis in this large worlde I spredde
                    quod she…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…right so fare I & therfore I yow preyegydeth my songe
                    that I shal of yow seye
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next folwith the seconde with hir tale & cetera (f.
                    164); the prolog (RT)

BodBar20.First Lines:
O lord oure lord þyn name how meruaillousis in this large
                    world I sprad quod she…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Right so fare I and therfore I ȝow praieGidith my song
                    þat I shal ȝow say

Bod414.First Lines:
[G]Od oure lord thy name houȝ merueylousIn this large world is
                    spredde quod she…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Ryght so fare I and therfore I you preyGidith my song and I
                    shalle of you sey

Bod686.First Lines:
O lorde o lorde þy name how meruelousIs in this large worlde
                    ysparde quod she…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Right so fare I and þerfore y you prayGydeth my songe
                    þat I of you shal sey
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the prohemium / of the Prioresse tale (f. 166v);
                    Here endeth the prohemium… (f. 167)

                    184); The Prioresse (RT)

BodRawC86.First Lines:
O goode lord thyn Name how mervelousIs in this large worlde spredde
                    quod she…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…Ryght so fare I and therfor I you preyeTendyr myn songe
                    þat I shall you saye
BodRawC86.Note:
Chaucer’s Clerk’s Tale (on folios
                        156v-173v; lines IV.57-1200) and Prioress’s
                        Prologue and Tale (incomplete, on folios
                        174v-177v; lines VII.453-632) of the Canterbury
                        Tales. VII.467, 473, omitted in the Prologue.
